definition: victim of an accident/casualty/martyr for one's country

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: He became a martyr to French-Canadians.
sentences.chinese: 他成为说法语的加拿大人的死难者。

sentences.english: Ghosts of Lost Souls at Sea to be Shepherded Through the Watery Passageway.
sentences.chinese: 海上死难者的灵魂将乘着水路被保驾护航。

sentences.english: There are many women and children among the victims, who fell down and were trampled.
sentences.chinese: 很多死难者是妇女和儿童，她们在混乱中被挤倒踩死。

sentences.english: Family members mourned the loss of their loved ones at the World Trade Center.
sentences.chinese: 家属在世贸中心悼念死难者。

sentences.english: I just want to wish all victims of 911 rest in peace.
sentences.chinese: 我在此只想祝愿所有911的死难者安息。

sentences.english: All our friends are going or gone and we survive amongst the dead and the dying as on a battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 而我们则是战场上死难者和垂死者中的幸存者。

sentences.english: The victims were from the country's French-speaking region, Heer said.
sentences.chinese: Heer说，这些死难者都是来自瑞士境内的法语区。

sentences.english: People from every country voluntarily passed the hat around and collected as much as ten thousand dollars.
sentences.chinese: 各国人自发为死难者募捐，钱万美元之巨。

sentences.english: Chinese people came out on the streets and bowed their heads, in remembrance of the quake victims.
sentences.chinese: 中国人走出大街，低下头，哀悼地震中的死难者。

sentences.english: Soldiers lay individual wreaths for victims at the Pentagon Memorial in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 华盛顿五角大楼纪念馆，士兵为死难者敬献花圈。

sentences.english: , and long one of the more outspoken relatives.
sentences.chinese: 他是死难者亲属中最直言不讳的。

sentences.english: The cenotaph stands as a remembrance of those killed during the war.
sentences.chinese: 矗立着的纪念碑是对战争中死难者的纪念。

sentences.english: They also noted who survived and who didn't.
sentences.chinese: 他们还记下了幸存者和死难者。

sentences.english: Held in Moscow the day mourning for the victims.
sentences.chinese: 莫斯科为死难者举行一天哀悼。

definition: Never forget national humiliation, refers to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
to die in an accident/to die for a just cause
sufferer/a victim of a calamity/a person in distress
to observe a moment of silence in tribute
to offer sacrifices (to one's ancestors)/to hold or attend a memorial service

national humiliation, refers to Japanese incursions into China in the 1930s and 40s, and more especially to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
to grieve over sb's death/to lament sb's death/mourning
to mourn/to pay last respects/mourning/memorial (service etc)
